result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa R. Wagner

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa R. Wagner appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Lisa R. Wagner.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant enters a not guilty plea into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:44 AM Defendant Lisa R Wagner not in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Lisa R Wagner.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard on the appearance of defendant. 
State requests a warrant. State recommends $150.00 cash bond out.

11:14 AM Case recalled. Defendant Lisa R Wagner appeared via telephone.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Lisa R Wagner.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard, defendant was having trouble with her zoom information. Court will cancel the warrant. 
Attorney Kieler is heard, they are ready to proceed with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - Deputy Breeser. Sworn 
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Kieler 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Kieler objects to bind over. 
Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 


Arraignment set for September 12, 2022 2:00PM 
End 11:29 AM

9:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa R Wagner appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Lisa R Wagner.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard on the status.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

3:02 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa R. Wagner appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. 

Court will grant the request for a court appointed attorney. Court finds the defendant indigent.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
3:00 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Lisa R. Wagner appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. states she has e-filed a petition for court appointed attorney - first time was rejected, 2nd time was accepted
Clerk advises that the first submission was rejected, no subsequent filing was received.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa R. Wagner appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. Does not qualify for a public def.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:45 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa R. Wagner appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. Requests an extension so she may retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:09 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Lisa R. Wagner in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. provided a copy of the criminal complaint at this time
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  
Defendant states understanding.
  
Court questions def re: progress in hiring an attorney
Def. states she is getting paperwork for court appointed attorney today
Court advises def. she must apply to public defender first, if she is denied, court will consider appointing a court appointed attorney
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Def. requests court "seal" her case on CCAP due to domestic violence concerns
Court advises she cannot seal the case - advises her to reach out to a D.A. advocate
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
at Sheriff's Dept. - no $ pd.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:44 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lisa Renee Wagner in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
